conclusion: Understanding forces when rod is not energized and when energized.
Free body diagram for the rod when not energized: weight downward, tension upward.
System is in equilibrium: 2T = mg, so T = mg/2.
When energized: weight downward, tension 1/4T upward, magnetic force upward.
Magnetic force on the rod is given by F_B = BIL.
Solve for magnetic force: F_B = mg - mg/4, so F_B = 3mg/4.
Solve for current: BIL = 3mg/4, so I = 3mg/4BL.
Using right-hand rule to determine direction of current.
Current direction is from M to N.
Final answer: Current magnitude is 3mg/4BL, direction from M to N.
